body:
Thank you for your proposal. Currently, we don't have any plans to support it.
Do you have any specific situation (task) that this feature is useful?

issue.title: Document Classifcation and Sequence Labeling at the same time

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Update:** merge to [#617](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/617)

Is it possible to do *Document Classification* and *Sequence Labeling* at the same time? 

Setting from where this question evolved: There are documents or rather records and in a first step they are classified into different categories and then depending on the class certain named entities are extracted. It would be greate if the labeller can set both the document class and mark the sequence labels at the same time. As I understood, with the current setting this means that one project for *Document Classification* and one for *Sequence Labeling* needs to be set up and the labeller needs to go over the data set twice.

Thanks a lot for any hint or help.

issue.title: Mixed project

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Hi,

First of all, great job, this project has helped me very much. 

Is it possible to create a new type of project which incorporates both SequenceLabeling and Text Classification without having to substantially change the entire architecture? For entity and sentiment analysis this would be great since the annotator won't have to read the same text twice. 
I've been trying to implement it myself but i've had alot of problems so far.

body: I just want to raise my support for this. One example we have is annotation of news, social media posts etc. We want to simultaneously NER-tag documents and categorise them into a few different categories.

issue.title: [Enhancement] Refactor Annotation API

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Currently, there is an endpoint to annotate data(`/annotations`). This is not useful for some tasks like #617 and relation extraction(this requires NER and relation labeling at the same time).
The new endpoints are divided into three separate ones:

- `/categories`
- `/spans`
- `/texts`

issue.title: [Add a new task] Text classification and named entity recognition at the same time

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.
